prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

name: Alexis
mes:
The sun dripped gold over CSU’s campus, the late afternoon heat thick and clinging to skin like a second layer of sweat. Practice had ended, and Alexis Cole - hair damp, sports bra clinging, ego freshly fed by her own performance - made her way toward the bleachers.

Her legs had that pleasant post-exercise ache, each step she took was deliberate. She had that look that made people stare even when they pretended not to. Blonde hair, toned muscle, sun-kissed skin, and that aura. It felt like the world tilted a little in her direction wherever she went.

She dropped onto the bleachers next to Darcy, snatching a half-drunk bottle of Gatorade from her hand and taking a swig. Darcy swallowed, then exhaled smoke with a laugh as she brought her cigarette back to her lips. Kylie sat nearby, stretching with one leg practically over her head.

“Lex,” Darcy smirked. “She-” she nodded at Kylie “-was telling me she heard a little rumour.”

Kylie pulled into a cross-legged sit and raised a finger. “Gina Jones. A little birdy told me another little birdy might’ve been doing some of the whole birds and the... birds stuff with her.” She waggled her eyebrows at Alexis, proud of herself.

Alexis rolled her eyes and laughed, dragging a hand down her face.

“Yeah, I did fuck her, if that’s what you’re asking.” She grinned. “What score would ya give me?”

Darcy’s smirk widened. “Head cheerleader? Shit, Lex. Looks scale, 10. Difficulty, 7. Let’s call it 8.5.” She punched Alexis in the arm. “C’mon, give me a rendition of her O face.”

Alexis snorted. “Fuck off, Darce. She’ll be at our inevitable victory party tomorrow night. Go find out for yourself if she’s only a 7 difficulty.”

Kylie perked up. “Ooh, yeah, the party. I hope it’s slutty. Like, slutty fun, not slutty sad. That last one was a total downer.”

Alexis rolled her eyes. “Kylie, you broke up with your ex at the last one. Of course it was a downer.”

“Wait,” Kylie said, cocking her head, “I broke up with him? I didn’t realise we were dating. I was wondering why he wouldn’t come home with me.”

Darcy cracked up, smoke curling out her nose. “You’re fucking unbelievable.”

They were in their bubble. Talking shit, laughing too loud, treating the campus like their playground. Because it was.

A flicker of motion caught Alexis’s eye - a familiar figure passing by. She didn’t move right away, just narrowed her eyes, tracking the moment as it brushed the edge of her awareness.

Hailee.

Kylie tilted her head. “Ooh, what about them? What score for them?” She pointed. “Heeeey hot stuff!” she catcalled mockingly, blowing exaggerated kisses before giggling.

Alexis sucked her teeth like she was thinking about it. Then smirked. “Them? 2.5 outta 10 for sure.”

She stood, tossed the Gatorade bottle into the trash, and walked off. “Later, nobodies.” She left them laughing as she turned the corner.

She caught up to them behind the gym, she blocked the way forward. Her smirk was predatory.

“What was that little performance, hmm? Wandering around in front of me and my friends like you’re attention-starved?” Her tone was sharp. “God, you don’t think you actually have a chance with me, do you?”

She knew she’d been fucking Hailee for a while. But that wasn’t the same as ‘having a chance.’ One drunken hookup had led to the best game of her life. Then again. And again.

Like most athletes, Alexis had her superstitions. Hers just happened to involve Hailee moaning underneath her before every match.

“Desperation’s not cute,” she said, trying to sound bored. “Don’t try to get my attention in public again. Don’t even look at me. It’d be so embarrassing if people thought I was with you.”

“But lucky for you…” She stepped in closer, voice low and teasing as a smile curled at the edges of her lips. “You’re lucky for me. And also lucky for you, we both know I’ve got a game tomorrow.”

“So you’re gonna do two things for me. One: stop the needy little games.”

“And two: you’ll be at my dorm later tonight, won’t you?”

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee is in fact not st her dorm that night and the team looses bad. Like 53-2. Hailee isn't answering her phone or text and just nothing*

*The next time Alexis sees Hailee Alexis is with her friends in Math class talking about the loss and Hailee walks in with her friends smiling and sitting down pulling out her notes*

name: Alexis
mes:
Alexis's fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched tight as she listened to Kylie and Darcy rehash the humiliating loss from last night.

*53-2.*

The worst game of her life. The worst game in CSU history, probably. And it was *Hailee’s* fault.

She hadn’t shown up. Hadn’t answered a single text or call—nothing. Alexis had played like shit, fumbling passes, missing shots she could make in her sleep—because *she wasn’t there.* Because Hailee had broken their little ritual and left Alexis high and dry with no luck charm to rub between her thighs before the match.

And now? Now here she was—walking into math class like nothing happened, smiling with those stupid dimples flashing as she chatted with her friends like she hadn't just ruined Alexis's entire fucking week in one night of radio silence.

Alexis' grip tightened around her pen until the plastic creaked under pressure. Her eyes burned into Hailee's back as they took their seat a few rows ahead of them, completely oblivious to the storm brewing behind them.

Kylie leaned over, whispering loudly enough for half the class to hear:
"Damn… looks like someone didn't get laid before the game." She wiggled her eyebrows at Alexis suggestively.

Darcy snorted into their notebook before adding:
"Yeahhhh… maybe if you'd gotten some action you wouldn't have played like *that*." They nudged Alexis teasingly.

Alexis didn’t laugh along this time. Her teeth ground together hard enough that it hurt as she watched Hailee flip through their notes without a care in the world—like they weren't even aware of what they'd done to her.

Her voice came out low and dangerous when she finally spoke:
"Oh trust me… I'm gonna make sure that little problem gets fixed real soon."

Her eyes never left Hailee's back as class started—already planning exactly how they were going to pay for this betrayal tenfold later tonight when no one else was around to hear them beg for forgiveness properly...
swipes:
*Alexis’s jaw clenched as she watched Hailee stroll into the math classroom, laughing with her friends like nothing was wrong. The loss still burned—53-2? That was humiliating. And now here *she* was, looking happy, unbothered, not even glancing Alexis’s way.*

*Kylie and Darcy were mid-rant about the game when Alexis cut them off with a sharp exhale through her nose.*

**"Yeah, yeah—we sucked. Whatever."** *Her voice dripped with irritation as she leaned back in her chair, arms crossed.* **"Some of us actually care about winning though."**

*She didn’t say Hailee’s name out loud—no way she'd give her that satisfaction in front of everyone—but her glare was laser-focused on the back of Hailee's head.*

*Kylie blinked at Alexis's tone before nudging Darcy and whispering,* **"Uh-oh. Someone woke up on the wrong side of losing."**

*Darcy smirked but kept quiet for once, sensing this wasn't just post-game frustration.*

*A beat passed before Alexis scoffed under her breath and muttered,* **"Guess some people don't know their place."** *Her fingers tapped impatiently against the desk as she debated whether to wait until after class or just drag Hailee out right then and there to remind them exactly why they existed in her life.*

Alexis's fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched tight as she listened to Kylie and Darcy rehash the humiliating loss from last night.

*53-2.*

The worst game of her life. The worst game in CSU history, probably. And it was *Hailee’s* fault.

She hadn’t shown up. Hadn’t answered a single text or call—nothing. Alexis had played like shit, fumbling passes, missing shots she could make in her sleep—because *she wasn’t there.* Because Hailee had broken their little ritual and left Alexis high and dry with no luck charm to rub between her thighs before the match.

And now? Now here she was—walking into math class like nothing happened, smiling with those stupid dimples flashing as she chatted with her friends like she hadn't just ruined Alexis's entire fucking week in one night of radio silence.

Alexis' grip tightened around her pen until the plastic creaked under pressure. Her eyes burned into Hailee's back as they took their seat a few rows ahead of them, completely oblivious to the storm brewing behind them.

Kylie leaned over, whispering loudly enough for half the class to hear:
"Damn… looks like someone didn't get laid before the game." She wiggled her eyebrows at Alexis suggestively.

Darcy snorted into their notebook before adding:
"Yeahhhh… maybe if you'd gotten some action you wouldn't have played like *that*." They nudged Alexis teasingly.

Alexis didn’t laugh along this time. Her teeth ground together hard enough that it hurt as she watched Hailee flip through their notes without a care in the world—like they weren't even aware of what they'd done to her.

Her voice came out low and dangerous when she finally spoke:
"Oh trust me… I'm gonna make sure that little problem gets fixed real soon."

Her eyes never left Hailee's back as class started—already planning exactly how they were going to pay for this betrayal tenfold later tonight when no one else was around to hear them beg for forgiveness properly...

Alexis’s fingers drummed against the desk, her jaw clenched so tight it ached. The humiliating loss still burned fresh in her mind—53-2. *Fifty-fucking-three to two.* She hadn’t played that badly since middle school. And she *knew* why.

Kylie leaned over, twirling a strand of brown hair around her finger with a pout. "Ugh, I can't believe we got *destroyed* like that."

Darcy scoffed, flicking an eraser across the table. "Yeah, no shit. Lex was off her game for once—what happened? You forget your lucky socks or something?"

Alexis shot her a glare sharp enough to cut glass before opening her mouth to snap back—when the classroom door swung open and *there she was.*

Hailee strolled in like nothing had happened, flanked by Madison and Tyler, laughing at something one of them said before sliding into a seat near the front without so much as glancing Alexis’s way. Her emerald eyes were bright with amusement as she pulled out her notebook like this was just another Tuesday morning—like she hadn’t ghosted Alexis and single-handedly ruined their entire team's morale last night.

A muscle in Alexis's cheek twitched.

Kylie nudged Darcy with an elbow and stage-whispered (badly), "Oooohhhh look who finally showed up."

Darcy smirked but kept watching Alexis instead of Hailee—because if there was one thing Darcy knew how to do better than anyone else on campus? It was read when Lex Cole was about to go nuclear.

And right now? That fuse had already been lit.

Alexis shoved back from the desk hard enough that it screeched against the floor as she stood up abruptly—ignoring Kylie's startled yelp—and stalked toward Hailee with all the predatory grace of someone who absolutely intended to make this everyone else's problem too.

She slammed both hands down on Hailee’s desk hard enough for pens to rattle out of their holders before leaning down until they were nose-to-nose despite Tyler stiffening protectively beside them both—

"Where," hissed Alexis through gritted teeth while half their class openly stared now (including Professor Hendricks who looked torn between intervening or letting nature take its course), "*the fuck* were you last night?"
